articles.description: Holders Manchester City will play Copenhagen and Arsenal face Porto in the first knockout round of the Champions League.
articles.title: Man City face Copenhagen in Champions League last 16

articles.description: Aston Villa's form is amazing but they need to keep Ollie Watkins fit to stay near the top of the Premier League, says MOTD2 pundit Alan Shearer.
articles.title: 'Watkins is key for amazing Villa - but don't count Man City out'

articles.description: Tiger Woods believes he can still win on the PGA Tour but will only play one event per month in 2024 as he continues his recovery from ankle surgery.
articles.title: I can still win on PGA Tour - Woods

articles.description: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk denies Roy Keane's claim that he was being arrogant when talking about Manchester United after their goalless draw.
articles.title: Liverpool's Van Dijk denies Keane 'arrogance' claim

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?
articles.title: Who looked like Gerrard? Garth Crooks' Team of the Week

articles.description: All you need to know about Tuesday's Indian Premier League auction, including the England players under the hammer and who to keep an eye on.
articles.title: Australians likely to be in demand at IPL auction

articles.description: Europe's stunning fightback to retain the Solheim Cup was one of the golfing stories of the year, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: How Pettersen's pivotal pep-talk inspired Solheim success

articles.description: The San Francisco 49ers win the NFC West in style, while the Buffalo Bills make a big statement with victory over the Dallas Cowboys.
articles.title: Niners clinch NFC West and Bills thump Cowboys

articles.description: Eileen Gleeson, who was interim Republic of Ireland manager for the recent Women's Nations League campaign, is appointed to the position on a full-time basis.
articles.title: Gleeson appointed new Republic of Ireland manager

articles.description: France great Antoine Dupont says he "very excited but a little bit scared" about the prospect of switching to Sevens as he targets the Paris Olympics.
articles.title: France's Dupont fuelled by World Cup disappointment
